name: Easy Drunken Noodles
description: Drunken Noodles (Pad Kee Mao) are a Thai favorite made with wide rice noodles, Thai basil and vegetables. There is often meat and fish sauce in the authentic version, but I've kept this recipe 100% vegan. Ready in less than 30 minutes!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup low sodium soy sauce (use tamari for gluten free)
1/4 cup vegan oyster sauce (omit if you don't have it)
2 tablespoons Sriracha hot sauce, more or less to taste
2 large carrots, peeled and cut into rounds
1  red bell pepper, seeded and sliced
1 1/2 cups Thai basil, sliced or chopped
1 cup canned baby corn, drained and rinsed

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the noodles according to package instructions. Drain, rinse in cold water and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the noodles according to package instructions. Drain, rinse in cold water and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all sauce ingredients in a small bowl until combined. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix all sauce ingredients in a small bowl until combined. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over high heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds, then add the onion and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over high heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds, then add the onion and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the carrots, broccoli and bell pepper to the skillet, and cook for 2 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the carrots, broccoli and bell pepper to the skillet, and cook for 2 more minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked noodles, green onions and sauce and stir for 1 minute until the sauce is coating the noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cooked noodles, green onions and sauce and stir for 1 minute until the sauce is coating the noodles.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from heat and stir in the basil and baby corn. Serve immediately, with more hot sauce or a sprinkle of red pepper flakes, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from heat and stir in the basil and baby corn. Serve immediately, with more hot sauce or a sprinkle of red pepper flakes, if desired.

itemListElement.text: To make this in your Instant Pot, do not cook the noodles first. Mix the sauce ingredients in a bowl. Press the sauté button on the IP, then add the oil along with the garlic, onions, carrots, broccoli and red bell pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes, then turn off the sauté.
itemListElement.name: To make this in your Instant Pot, do not cook the noodles first. Mix the sauce ingredients in a bowl. Press the sauté button on the IP, then add the oil along with the garlic, onions, carrots, broccoli and red bell pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes, then turn off the sauté.

itemListElement.text: Add the sauce and 3 cups of vegetable broth or water,  to the pot, and de-glaze the pan, scraping off any stuck bits. Add the noodles and push them down into the broth so they are mostly covered. Cook at high pressure for 3 minutes, then do a quick release. Open the pot, and give everything a good stir. Add the green onions, basil and corn and cover for 5 more minutes. Toss again and serve immediately.
